Bud Root Dropping.symptoms: Premature dropping of buds, yellowing and weakening of the bud before falling.
Bud Root Dropping.description: This condition causes young buds to fall off prematurely, hindering the growth and yield of the plant.
Bud Root Dropping.causes: Nutrient deficiencies, particularly nitrogen; stress conditions like water imbalance, excessive heat, or pest infestation.

Bud Rot.symptoms: Soft, mushy buds with discoloration; foul smell from the rotting tissues.
Bud Rot.description: A disease affecting the growing buds, causing them to decay and prevent further growth.
Bud Rot.causes: Fungal infections triggered by high humidity and poor ventilation; overwatering or waterlogged soil.

Gray Leaf Spot.symptoms: Small, gray to brown oval spots on leaves; lesions may merge, leading to leaf blight.
Gray Leaf Spot.description: A fungal disease that causes significant damage to leaves, reducing photosynthetic activity and overall plant health.
Gray Leaf Spot.causes: Fungal infection by Cercospora species; spread through infected plant debris, wind, or water splashes.

Leaf Rot.symptoms: Yellow or brown patches on leaves; leaves become soft, slimy, and eventually rot.
Leaf Rot.description: A condition where the leaf tissues decompose, impacting the plant's ability to photosynthesize.
Leaf Rot.causes: High moisture levels and fungal or bacterial infections; poor drainage and lack of air circulation.

Stem Bleeding.symptoms: Dark, sticky fluid oozing from the stem; wilting or yellowing of leaves near the affected area.
Stem Bleeding.description: A serious condition where sap or other fluids leak from the stem, weakening the plant.
Stem Bleeding.causes: Fungal infections or mechanical injuries; poor plant management, such as overwatering or improper pruning.
